<rule id="embedded-framework-09100" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <or>
                    <file filename="{*}zipkin{*}.jar"/>
                    <project>
                        <artifact artifactId="spring-cloud-starter-zipkin" groupId="org.springframework.boot"/>
                    </project>
                    <project>
                        <artifact artifactId="{*}" groupId="io.zipkin{*}"/>
                    </project>
                </or>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint category-id="information" effort="0" title="Embedded framework - Zipkin">
                    <message>
                        The application embeds the Zipkin framework. To migrate a Java application that uses Zipkin to Azure, it is recommended to use Azure Monitor instead.

                        * **Identify Zipkin dependencies**: Identify the Zipkin dependencies in your application.

                        * **Replace with Azure Monitor**: Azure Monitor provides distributed tracing capabilities. Azure services such as Azure Spring Apps, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure App Service support auto-instrumentation for Azure Monitor.
                    </message>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/" title="Azure Monitor"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/developer/java/migration/migrate-spring-cloud-to-azure-spring-apps?pivots=sc-standard-tier#identify-zipkin-dependencies" title="Spring Boot to Azure - identify Zipkin dependencies"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/spring-apps/how-to-application-insights" title="Use Application Insights Java In-Process Agent in Azure Spring Apps"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/app/distributed-trace-data" title="Distributed Tracing"/>
                </hint>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">Zipkin</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>
